Text.Value: *Your words may be false, but they ring truer than Mol's tales. You're off the hook.*
I explore the secrets of the universe. I don't have time to threaten children.
Oh those kids - they're playing a joke on me.
*Your claims fall flat. Things could turn ugly here, very rapidly.*
*Your menacing words fizzle out like a match dropped in a latrine.*
I'm a dab hand at threatening adults as well. Want to see?
*Threats landed you in trouble, but more threats have set you free again. Wonderful.*
*Your lies only inflame the matter further. Things could turn ugly, very rapidly.*
Children? I haven't spoken to any children.
*Your attempt at bribery only inflames the matter further. Things could turn ugly, very rapidly.*
*Your words are heavy with righteousness and sincerity. Enough to get you off the hook, this time.*
*An unorthodox defence - but one that seems to have worked. You are free to go.*
I would never threaten a child. I can't even imagine it.
*It seems Mol was as good as her word. She's reported that you've been threatening children.*

Synopsis: Non-critpath. Occurs when a guard confronts players who have offended Mol, teenage crime boss in the Druid Grove. The player can try talk their way out of trouble, attempt a bribe, fight or surrender.
